title: Back From Vacation
description: Michael isn't supposed to let anyone know that he and Jan went on vacation together in Jamaica, but he accidentally circulates a compromising photo of them to the office via e-mail.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right, let's get started. Umm... Oh, first off, we're supposed to be pushing cardstock this week. So... let's push cardstock this week. Uh, also... [to Dwight] what is this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Tape recorder.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: For what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: For recording. Michael is on vacation and he's asked me to record all meetings and to type up the transcripts.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK. Uh, Karen, any news from that law firm?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah, the deal closed yesterday, it's the six month commitment.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God, Dwight, what're you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're not allowed to take off your pants in the middle of the office.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm not.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, you know what, just back up, okay, that's making me uncomfortable. This is sexual harassment, by the way. Oh my God! He's got a knife!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I do not have a knife!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, let the record show that Dwight K. Schrute is now completely nude and is holding a plastic knife to Stanley's neck?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [leans into tape recorder] Let the record show that Jim Halpert is a liar!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [picks up tape recorder and speaks into it] Dwight Schrute is now wearing a baby's bonnet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Give me it. I am not.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, Jim Carrey just walked in! Dwight, get his autograph for Michael quickly...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim Carrey did not just walk in, OK.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Dwight, what is that on your stomach? Is that a Muppet Babies tattoo?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God, Karen, you're right, that is Animal from the Muppet Babies.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You can't see... You can't see my stomach.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I am now chopping off Phyllis' head with a chainsaw! ... Rin-in-in-in-in-in!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, mon!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey. You have a bunch of messages and... [sees Michael shaking head with beads in hair] that's nice. Hannah quit while you were gone. I guess she memo-ed to file some complaints she had about being a working mother? And so you might also have to be deposed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, blah. Relax.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just relax, OK? I'll get to all of it later.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's kind of serious.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Aren't you going to ask me how Jamaica was? Say it. Ask me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How was Jamaica?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was so good. Oh, Hey mon! At Sandals, Jamaica, when somebody says "Hey mon," everybody says "Hey mon" back.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh, Michael, I'm glad you're here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stanley. You know what? It is really good to see you, too.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: My bonus check was a hundred dollars less than you promised.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, well payroll is in charge of all that.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: They said I should talk to you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I am just getting settled in. So, I'm gonna...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I am not doing a lick more work until I get my full bonus check.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are not as much fun as your Jamaican brothers... mon.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You want to talk about it?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I still haven't found an apartment yet. I'm living in a hotel. Yesterday, I saw a "for rent" sign down the street from Jim and he said he didn't think it'd be such a good idea. He said it would be like we were living together. In different houses. Two blocks away.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Feelin' hot, hot, hot! [playing conch shell] Feelin' hot, hot, hot! Feelin' hot, hot, hot! Feelin' hot, hot, hot! That's all I know so far, but I'm gonna keep practicing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's good. [Michael continues to play conch shell]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, I had never been out of the country before now?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Huh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Got to see how Jamaicans live. It is great, you know. They just relax, they party all the time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's kind of an impoverished country.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah... Gosh. Great. You know what, Pam? Make a note. I want us all to start having pina coladas every day at three.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: But you can't today, we're doing inventory.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Inventory's at the end of December.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We couldn't do it without you, so we postponed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I specifically went on vacation so I would miss it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Inventory is boring. In the islands, they don't make you do stuff like take inventory. Why do you think so many businesses move to the Caymans?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tonight, we are going to have an inventory luau. I want to bring back a little slice of paradise to the Dunder Mifflin warehouse inventory. So, Party Planning Committee, get on it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: By the end of the day? That's impossible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The Jamaicans don't have a word for "impossible."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep, it's English, it's "impossible."

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Michael, there's no way we can do it in time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How hard is a luau? All you need are some grass skirts, pineapple, poi, tiki torches, suckling pig, some fire dancers. That's all you need.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on in. Settle in. Settling. Settling... and settled. Good, there is something I would like to show everybody. See this sign? [points to a TV monitor of a picture from Jamaica and reads] "No Shirt, No Shoes, No Problem." This is an attitude I would like all of you to have right here. So what, if we have to stay late to do inventory? No problem.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God. Is that Jan? [points to same monitor]

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.text: What? Where?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: On the left.

quotes.speaker: Everybody
quotes.text: Oh yeah, oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no. No, that's a German woman named Urkel Grue.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jan told me to play it cool and not tell anybody because it can get us both in trouble. So officially, I did not see her. But I did see Jan there. In our room. At night. And in the morning. That's all I'm gonna say. Sex. We had sex. I had sex with her. I had sex with Jan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] Hey dude. I just got back from Jamaica.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Big whoop! I was in Hot-lanta. That whole town is whacked.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, that sounds amazing. You know what? The lady Jan Levinson wanted to go to Montego Bay.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: You took the ice queen? I don't buy it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well I'm looking at a photo, right now. And I'm telling 'ya, could be in Maxim.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: They wouldn't give you a subscription to Maxim.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh no?

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. Well, check this out. I am sending you some email. You got it?

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Well, no. I got nothing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Check it again. Hit refresh.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Yeah, Mike, still nothing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, wait a second. I sent it to you at... [reading computer screen] [email protected] Packaging@DunderMifflin.com. Uh oh.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.text: Wait, I just got it from somebody else. Wow. This is hot. Damn! How do I get you out of this picture?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Darryl?! Hey. Hi. Where's Darryl?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: He's in the office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, Hey, man, how's it going?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: All right, what's up Mike?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's great, OK. Um, so did you get an email from me?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. Well, that was supposed to go to Packer, not "packaging." Did you already, um, forward to a whole bunch of people?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. Um, well, did you get the second email that I sent? Explaining that the first email was a mistake and that you should delete it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And you sent that out to everyone?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Mike, I'm very busy down here. [eats chicken]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yikes.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Already sent it to you my friend.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Fantastic.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Boring. Call me if she rolls over.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You OK?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You sure?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Yes. Um, I'm just in this, like, stupid fight with Karen.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh. You want to talk about it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have a special assignment for you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Who's the target?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A sensitive email has been released to the office. It contains a file, a picture. The file name is "Jamaican Jan Sun Princess."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What's it of?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not important.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Unless you're willing to tell me everything, I cannot accept this assignment.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, forget it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, I accept it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, I dunno, I just feel likes we've been dating a month, right? Same street. I think that might be a little close. A little much.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hmm, what?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How far away does she live now, like ten minutes?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I guess.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Honestly, I think you should go easy on her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I didn't mind helping Jim with his problem. That's what friends do. I help Phyllis all the time. Just yesterday, I untangled a piece of tape from her hair. So, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, thanks a lot.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, don't worry about it. I mean, it's better than listening to Michael play a conch shell... which is what I was doing. Oh, also, Michael went to Jamaica with Jan!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, How have we not talked about this already? I mean what happened there? Kidnapping? [both start laughing]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey I need to talk to you right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not now, not ever.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: About you and Jan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Aww, none of your business.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Wish it were true, but it, it uh, seems from that photo that you took, you've entered into an intimate relationship.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That photo is my personal property and if you are telling me you went on my computer and stole that photo, then I am going to call the cops.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Michael, nine different people emailed me that photo, including my ex-wife... we don't talk now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is probably the icebreaker you need.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You know, for your own protection, you should disclose the relationship to HR.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I bet you would love all the details, wouldn't you? Skeevy little perv.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: All right, if you're having a relationship with your superior, you must disclose it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no. I am not dating Jan. She was very clear about that. Just two like souls having a romantic time in the most romantic place on earth. Got enough, weirdo?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: All right, thanks Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: OK, we only have three hours people to plan a whole luau, and you're not helping.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: What are the ingredients of poi?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I called every grocery store in Scranton, and no one sells whole pigs.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Did you try the petting zoo?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on phone] Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Just a second. Michael, it's Jan on the phone for you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, God, no. No, no! Hang up! Hang up! Tell her I'm not here. Tell... tell her, I ran out for cash. I hit a deer. I hit a deer with my car. Tell her I hit a cat. Tell her I hit a cat.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He'll call you back. OK, great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She bought it? [Pam nods] OK. OK.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to Jim and Ryan] Michael hit a deer?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael! Michael! [pokes head through blinds in Michael's office] There's an emergency in the warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There an accident? Somebody hurt?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, it's... involves the photograph.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. God. No, no, no, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [starts clapping] Mike, you are a rock star, man. You are the man! Well done.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. [continued clapping and cheering for Michael]

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: That corporate booty, he likes to hit it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello. Hi. Attention everyone. Um, apparently, there is an email circulating around that contains a very PG-13 rating picture of me and a woman--

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Jan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Kevin. A woman. Maybe Jan, maybe...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Urkel Grue.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My point is that, if you get it, I would ask that you just delete it. Sight unseen. Let's be professional, all right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Feelin'... feelin' hot, hot, hot! [plays conch shell]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are you doing out here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Island living. You know?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jan called. She's coming in later to talk to you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did she say what it's about?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's all she said.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ole ole - ole ole... Ole ole - ole ole. People in the party - hot hot hot [playing conch shell]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, I think you dropped this [hands over piece of paper]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: You sure?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Definitely.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have disconnected the office T1 line. I have ordered that that [referring to large picture of Michael and Jan in Jamaica on the wall] be taken down and destroyed all print outs from the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There are copies in the bathroom?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There were. A lot of them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I think I owe you one.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sorry?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: For talking sense into Halpert. The Day's Inn room 228 was starting to get really depressing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, no. Don't worry about it. I mean, he was being ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah, but... thanks. Seriously.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, yes! Yes! What'd I tell you? I knew he'd turn up [holds up an iPod inside speakers] You see that? This is the greatest night of my life.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Who did this to you? [refers to Pam crying] Where is he?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What? No, it's not... it's nothing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [takes off coat to tie around waist] It's hot in here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Dwight hands out handkerchief] Thanks. You don't need to stay here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know. [puts arm around Pam who continues to cry] So you're PMSing pretty bad, huh?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hello everyone. Hello Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guh.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hi Jan, you look... tan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I was in Scottsdale visiting my sister.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah. How was it?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Very sunny. Family's important. Michael, I would like to speak with you, in your office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, yup.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Why am I here, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: In the last year, I've gone through a divorce, an identity theft, a husband who would not... communicate. This is nether here or there. My psychiatrist thinks that I have some self-destructive tendencies and that for once, I should indulge them. You following me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I... I... Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I think I owe it to myself to find some kind of happiness, you know? I mean, even, even if it means... lowering my expectations or, or redefining the word, itself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: This is the kind of thing, you know? I am... attracted to you. I, I don't know why, I... but, I am. And, I need to follow my instincts. At least that's what Dr. Perry thinks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who is Dr. Perry? I...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: This is the point, OK? You're wrong for me. In... In... every way. But I still find myself wanting to... be with you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I, to you, in addition, feel the same feelings that you are as well.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Good, good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, umm... thanks for coming by. So, I, uh...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, good, OK. Thank you... for taking the time...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well thanks for coming over, I appreciate - [Jan leans over and kisses Michael passionately]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Wait 15 minutes, find an excuse, and meet me at your condo.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jan, you... complete... me.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, God.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey, remember when we were planning our honeymoon and you wanted to go to Hawaii and I wanted to go to Mexico?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I was definitely right. [both laugh] Oh, brother.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What am I going to do? [Refers to large pictures of Jan and Michael] I'm gonna hang it up at home. I don't have a lot of art. [smirks]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just had the best, most romantic week of my life in Sandals, Jamaica. Went with a lady, and we laid on the beach and drank fruity drinks for free, because it was all-inclusive. And then I flew back to Scranton, and then they lost one of my bags.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Mister tally man, tally me banana, six hand, seven hand, eight hand, BRUNCH! [snickers] So delicious. Dinner, too. And every morning I would watch the sunrise and I would eat a mango. That is how I want to feel all the time. It's called island living. You know, how they say take a chill pill? In Jamaica, I took one. Guy on the beach sold it to me for $40. And after I finished vomiting, I was more relaxed than I ever have been. Lost six pounds, too. That's how I want every day to be.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael sends me a postcard from every vacation he goes on. Atlantic City, he wishes I was here. Busch Gardens, Virginia, all I got was this lousy postcard. And this time, I'm Jamaican-him-crazy. I don't know how far away he thought he was, because he put $10 worth of stamps on this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello, you're back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, mon. Me just got back to the office.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: While you were gone...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Me had an i-rey time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: While you were gone, Jim glued my desk drawers together. He changed my voicemail so that my voice sounded like a chipmunk. He told me that we had a meeting at 4:00 AM, and I was the only one who showed up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, please, please.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He turned over my...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just got back from vacation, mon, all right? So chill. Let's don't... Don't harsh my mellow, mon.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I took a vacation once. Never again. While I was away, Jim had my desk shipped to me in Roswell.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Presents. I got presents for everybody. Dwight, a genuine Rastafarian wig.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Unbelievable.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Andy, I got you a genuine Jamaican T-shirt. They love Milli Vanilli down there.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I give thanks, mon.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are so welcome, mon. Angela, you just got leied. [puts lei on Angela]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, I didn't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, you did. Okay. Oh, Pam, I forgot to get you something.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm just kidding. Coconuts for your coconuts!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs] Try it on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Go ahead. Let me know if I miscalculated the size. I don't think I did.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stanley, I got you some ganja. I'm just kidding. It's coffee. I bet you wish it was ganja.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I just got back from vacay. Come on. Give me a break, man. [holds up CD] Waves over Jamaica, $6.99.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Did he actually give you some ganja?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: You want some?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, let me tell you a little story. When I was on vacation, I met a man named Bavon. And Bavon takes people parasailing. And you know what he said to me? He said that he loves going to work every day. How many of you can say that you love going to work every day like Bavon? [Dwight and Andy raises hand] No one.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: But, Michael, Buvon gets to go parasailing every day, and that's fun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: His name is Bavon. And you know what? I'm sure Bavon gets sick of his job, too. I'm sure he would like to take a day off. I'm sure he would like to spend a vacation selling paper, but he has the right attitude. And that is something that you learn when you go to Jamaica, and you really apply yourself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would love to take them all to Jamaica, but is that good management? Yes. But is it the best management? Well, I can't afford it, and corporate won't pay for it. So who's the real criminal?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How many of you know the meaning of the Jamaican term, Hakuna Matata?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [raises hand] Are you stoned?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: In the picture, are you high?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, that's red eye.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is that not what happens when you're high?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You look like you have the munchies.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I have the munchies. I'm gonna get some of those chocolate wafers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, can we just focus?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael and Jan together in Jamaica. I guess I would just need a little bit more evidence than seeing it with my own eyes.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don't know if Michael and Jan really went to Jamaica, because Michael's way into Photoshop. For example, I never went with him to Egypt. [holds up picture with Michael and himself in Egypt]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Where did you save the list of exchanges?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I will gladly give you that information when my bonus comes through.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: But I won't be able to do inventory without it.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Then you won't be able to do inventory.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, I really like Stanley, but I'm not always sure if he likes me. I guess that's okay, 'cause I don't really like him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Well, Jan's email password is not Dunder Mifflin, Sandals, Jamaica, Michael, Michael Scott, Jan Scott, or Mrs. Jan Scott.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Try Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Her passwords aren't going to be Dwight, Dwight. That's stupid. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't you have some sort of chaser or gobbler thing that you can send out that's able to eat up that other emails? I read about something like that. Well, I am in America and I am online, so I do think it involves you. Uh-huh. And if I were a subscriber, would then you be able to send out the gobbler? I'd... Yes, I will hold.

quotes.speaker: Someone
quotes.text: So your trip to Scottsdale was good?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh yeah, Arizona's beautiful. Yeah. It's great to... great to see my sister.

quotes.speaker: Someone
quotes.text: Burnt.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, I know. I don't... I don't normally lay out in the sun a lot, but, you know, when it's Scottsdale... I was visiting my sister and...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: When a woman gets older, she'll go just about anywhere with just about anyone. I've done some things I'm not so proud of, but I've seen the world.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Your body is a temple. You have to respect it. You can't just whore it out.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I should be turned on. But, last year, remember, I had that skin cancer scare, and so now all I can think is that I hope she was wearing sunscreen. God, I would love to rub some on her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The worst part about the Internet, when a secret is out, everyone knows. The best part about the Internet, that video of the dancing Indian midget, crossbow.org, massively multiplayer online gaming, i.e. Everquest. I also enjoy online banking.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. So I went on the Internet, and she is not gonna find another apartment for that price. I mean this one is twice as much, and it doesn't have parking. Does she like to park?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, loves it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. This one is the same price but it's got...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Green walls.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think that's mold.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ooh... fancy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Spiderman, Peter Parker, would not reveal his love for Mary Jane for fear that she might be captured and harmed by the Green Goblin. Now, if Michael had studied the Spidey principles that I'd drawn up for him, Jan's boobs might not be all over the Internet. [Dwight pretends to shoot out webs from his palms]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Attention everyone! May I have your attention, please? Listen up. If we all work really hard and focus, we should be out of here in seven hours. Now, somewhere in these stacks, I have hidden a deck of cards. That should motivate you to keep your eyes open. If you find the deck of cards, you can redeem it with me in exchange for a free soft drink. [Jim shuffles the deck of cards] Get back... Back to work!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, it is The Island Luau Inventory '07. It's actually a success compared to Disco Audit '05.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: What's the problem?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: We have seven fewer boxes of Canariola copier paper in stock than we're supposed to.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Let me see this. [scans one box seven times] Looks good to me.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I wouldn't have come, but I know Jan is showing up soon. I don't wanna miss the show.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Kelly singing] Hey! Hey! Stop your mouth, please.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Eighty-six. Eighty-seven. [singing] Eighty-eight. Eighty-nine.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey Dwight, I bet I can stack faster than you can.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please, I can double your pace.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, yeah? Prove it, champ. You ready?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: One, two, three, go!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Dwight and Andy stacking boxes rapidly] Nice.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Get out of my way, Jim!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim, move!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dang it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Two at a time!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Those aren't straight. Totally crooked. Totally crooked. You're disqualified.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [to herself] Be careful. [yells as boxes fall on her] Hello? I'm stuck!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Stanley, in case I don't see you again after tonight, here is your bonus, $1,000 cash. Keep the change. [hands Stanley a piece of Jamaican currency]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: There is a butterfly on this. Why?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is Jamaican. The exchange rate is 65-to-1. I don't remember in which direction.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: So it's either worth $15 bucks or $65,000.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, good luck with that.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You know, I actually lived in Honolulu for a year.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, so you've been to a real luau.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I tried. We didn't have time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're a box short on the black, medium-line ballpoints.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I don't know what to tell you.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: One year, I had a close acquaintance of mine back a truck in here and clean out this whole place. That was a very good year. I think they blamed it on some kid.
